result.execSummary:
The defendant Danesha T Radford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Danesha T Radford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Danesha T Radford was found guilty of Abandonment of a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.20.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Defendant to complete a parenting and nurturing class.  Defendant to cooperate with Children's Court Orders.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danesha T Radford

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Branch 36 is in jury trial and will not be able to hear this case. This case will be heard by Branch 7 on behalf of Branch 36. Parties notified case sent forthwith.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court, defendant Danesha T Radford not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  Defense requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court, defendant Danesha T Radford not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab supervised by Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case set for a Scheduling Conference at request of the state. Case adjourned to branch 23.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case rescheduled for 8:30 AM on 6/26/2015. Branch 23 has probation review hearings scheduled at 1:30 PM on 6/26/2015. Notice of Hearing sent to the parties.

Defendant Danesha T Radford in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Danesha T Radford in custody.  Sarah Zwech, student intern under the supervision of Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ZRR (9/30/13)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danesha T Radford in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Danesha T Radford in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense, DUE TO DUPLICITY OF CHARGES argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE FOR BRANCH 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
